centurio
Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
  centurio.GameLogic

public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object

This class defines the methods for the game logic, which will be used from the artificial intelligence.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Felix Maximilian Möller, Marius Schneider, Martin Wegner

Method Detail

getAllPlayers

public java.util.LinkedList<com.parctechnologies.eclipse.Atom> getAllPlayers()
calculates all player of the current game updates the variable numberOfPlayers

Returns:
all player of the current game in KIF Format,
e.g. :"[com.parctechnologies.eclipse.Atom with [functor=dropper], com.parctechnologies.eclipse.Atom with [functor=player]]"

to get the Player in String Format cast each element to CompoundTerm and access with "Object.funktor()"

Returns:
all player of the current game in KIF Format,
e.g. :"[com.parctechnologies.eclipse.Atom with [functor=dropper], com.parctechnologies.eclipse.Atom with [functor=player]]"

to get the Player in String Format cast each element to CompoundTerm and access with "Object.funktor()"

isParallel

public java.lang.Boolean isParallel()
determines if the game is parallel one

Returns:
is true if the game is parallel and false if not

randomGame

public java.lang.Object[] randomGame(java.lang.Object State)
Plays a whole random Game (sequence from actions and calculated states) till a terminal state. LinkedList of CoumpoundTerm needs type LinkedList

Parameters:
State - state where the random game begins
Returns:
[0] reached terminal state(CompoundTerm),
[1] used actions in the sequence(LinkedList of CoumpoundTerm)

randomGame

public java.lang.Object randomGame(java.lang.Object State,
                                   int n)
Plays a n random Games (sequence from actions and calculated states) till a terminal state.

Parameters:
State - state where the random game begins
n - number of games to play
Returns:
Object[i][0] terminal state reached(CompoundTerm),
Object[i][1] used actions in the sequence(LinkedList of CoumpoundTerm)
where i stands for the i'th randomgame

scoresState

public double[] scoresState(java.lang.Object State)
calculates the scores of all players of a given state

Parameters:
State - given State
Returns:
scores of all players

getNextState

public java.lang.Object getNextState(java.lang.Object State,
                                     java.lang.Object Move)
calculates the next state of a given state and action.
the representation of the state has to be unique!!!

Parameters:
State - given state
Move - action, which will be done from the state
Returns:
next state as a String[]
